name: cronmaster
description: Cronjob management UI with human readable syntax, live logging and log history for your cronjobs.
readme_summary: Cronmaster is a TypeScript-based web UI for managing cron jobs. It offers a user-friendly interface for creating, viewing, and deleting cron jobs and associated bash scripts, with features like live logging, log history, and system information display.
key_features: System Information display (uptime, memory, CPU, etc.)
Script Management (view, create, delete bash scripts)
Job Execution Logging (stdout, stderr, exit codes, timestamps)
primary_use_case: To provide a centralized, user-friendly web interface for managing and monitoring cron jobs and associated scripts, simplifying task scheduling and execution logging.
cover_image_prompt: A whimsical, anthropomorphic clockwork owl perched on a branch, meticulously organizing a series of glowing, interconnected gears representing scheduled tasks. The owl's eyes are screens displaying live log feeds and system status. Below, a small, stylized control panel with human-readable labels allows for easy interaction. Subtle digital particles flow around the gears, indicating data and execution. The background is a soft, gradient sky with a hint of a digital network. The overall style is a charming 3D isometric illustration with a clean, friendly aesthetic, emphasizing clarity and control over complex scheduling.

name: drip
description: Self-hosted tunneling solution to expose localhost securely - unlimited bandwidth, no third-party servers
readme_summary: Drip is a self-hosted tunneling solution written in Go that allows users to securely expose local services to the internet without relying on third-party servers. It offers unlimited bandwidth and requests, enabling users to use their own domains for custom subdomains.
primary_use_case: To securely expose a local development server or service to the internet for testing, collaboration, or public access, using a custom domain and without relying on external tunneling services.
cover_image_prompt: A solitary, stylized lighthouse standing on a rocky outcrop, its powerful beam of light reaching across a vast, dark ocean towards a distant, bustling city. The lighthouse represents the user's local machine, and its beam is a secure, glowing tunnel carrying data packets. The city represents the public internet. Small, subtle UI elements resembling a command line interface are integrated into the lighthouse's base, showing the 'drip' command. The overall mood is one of secure connection and reliable access, with a clean, modern digital art style and a focus on the contrast between the isolated lighthouse and the connected city.

name: OSX-PROXMOX
description: VoilÃ , install macOS on ANY Computer! This is really and magic easiest way! PVE 7.XX ~ 8.XX Support and macOS High Sierra ~ macOS Sequoia Support.
readme_summary: This repository provides a streamlined script to install and run macOS virtual machines on Proxmox VE, supporting a wide range of macOS and Proxmox versions on both AMD and Intel hardware. It simplifies the complex process of Hackintoshing within a virtualization environment.
key_features: Easy installation of macOS on Proxmox VE
Support for AMD and Intel hardware
Wide range of macOS versions supported (High Sierra to Sequoia)
Support for Proxmox VE versions 7.XX to 8.XX
primary_use_case: To enable users to easily install and run macOS as a virtual machine on Proxmox VE, effectively creating a Hackintosh within a virtualization platform.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, magical workbench where a user is assembling a sleek, modern Mac computer out of various digital components and glowing energy streams. The workbench itself is integrated into a server rack, symbolizing Proxmox VE. On one side, raw digital 'ingredients' like code snippets and binary data are being fed into a glowing portal. On the other side, a fully formed, illuminated macOS desktop interface is emerging from the portal, with icons for different macOS versions (High Sierra to Sequoia) clearly visible. The overall mood is one of effortless creation and technological magic, with subtle 'OSX-PROXMOX' branding integrated into the workbench design. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a clean, futuristic aesthetic and vibrant, contrasting colors.

name: gpu-hot
readme_summary: GPU Hot is a real-time, web-based dashboard for monitoring NVIDIA GPUs. It provides detailed metrics for utilization, memory, temperature, and processes, accessible without SSH, and can scale from single machines to large clusters.
primary_use_case: Real-time monitoring and visualization of NVIDIA GPU performance and system metrics for single machines or clusters, particularly useful for MLOps, AI/ML workloads, and DevOps.
cover_image_prompt: A futuristic control room where a central holographic display shows multiple glowing NVIDIA GPUs. Each GPU is represented by a vibrant, dynamic chart showing its real-time performance metrics like utilization, temperature, and memory usage, visualized as flowing energy streams. Small, subtle UI elements with code snippets and process IDs are integrated into the holographic interface. The overall mood is one of high-tech efficiency and deep insight into powerful hardware. The style is a clean, 3D isometric illustration with a cool blue and green color palette, emphasizing clarity and advanced technology.

name: Dropp
readme_summary: Dropp is a cross-platform application that provides a persistent dropzone on macOS, allowing users to drag files and sync them to the cloud. These files can then be accessed on other devices, such as Android phones, creating a seamless file transfer and accessibility experience across multiple platforms.
primary_use_case: Seamlessly transferring and accessing files across macOS and Android devices through a cloud-synced dropzone.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, glowing digital portal hovering above a sleek macOS laptop. Files are being dragged from the laptop's screen into the portal. On the other side of the portal, a stylized Android phone displays the same files. Subtle digital particles flow between the laptop and the phone, representing cloud sync. The background is a clean, modern workspace with soft lighting. The overall mood is efficient and futuristic. The repository name 'Dropp' is subtly integrated into the portal's design. Rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant, contrasting colors for clarity.
